dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Ooh, you're the new face! Wow, you must be up on all the latest tossball games.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: So who do you follow? Wait, don't tell me. You look like a Hammersmith Thunder fan! No, Glacial Age Mammoths.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: They're all pretty great!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm not here to chat about teams.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who has time to watch grown men and women hit balls with sticks?

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Aren't they just? When I get to worrying about the marauders outside, the raptidons chewing at the walls, I just turn my transceiver up to drown it all out!

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Most of the time it's static on account of the frequency being clogged up. But sometimes, it's tossball!

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: So, what can I do for you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I found this betting slip in a dead man's apartment. Any idea what might have happened to him?

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Poor Isaac! I was wondering why I hadn't seen him in a few days.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'd really like to help - Isaac was a sweet fellow. Even if he did have terrible teeth.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Cut to the chase. Do you know who did it or not?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm listening.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What do his teeth have to do with anything?

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: I don't know for sure, but I saw Elijah and his buddies pushing Isaac around.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: They're hooligans from Fallbrook - they sweep into town, drop supplies off behind the warehouse, and spend the rest of their stay getting rowdy over tossball games.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: They usually loiter in the alley behind The Yacht Club - they're not allowed in the bar anymore. I bet you anything Isaac ran into trouble with one of them.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Thanks for the tip.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll make them pay.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Mr. Sanjar'll be pleased to hear about it when you're done. I know he gets fed up with the Fallbrook bullies, but there's not much he can do.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Good! Someone's gotta.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Right, so the thing with Isaac is he didn't know where to stop. He'd get stuck on something, and he just couldn't let it go.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sometimes he'd drink Purpleberry Punch by the liter. Other times he'd keep betting on a losing team. Started owing the wrong people money.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So who did he owe?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Focus, please.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sorry.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: They were pretty distinct. Monarch doesn't exactly have a thriving dental industry, and Isaac seemed to get stuck in all sorts of bad habits. Dietary and otherwise.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: That's a shame. Tossball's just about the only good news we get around here. When our frequency's not too clogged up, anyway.

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Everyone needs a good diversion! That's what keeps you from thinking about the marauders outside town. The raptidons chewing at the walls...

dialog.speaker: Nellie (Female)
dialog.utterance: Tossball's just about the only good news we get around here. When our frequency's not too clogged up, anyway.
